title.narrative: PHASE-OUT METHYL BROMIDE IN GRAIN FUMIGATION (THIRD TRANCHE)

description.narrative: TECHNICAL ISSUES: The effective and more economical use of solid phosphine for outdoor covered bag-stacks and improved usage of solid phosphine for indoor bag-stacks will be the alternatives to MB in the grain storage sector in Syria IMPACT OF PROJECT ON COUNTRY#S MONTREAL PROTOCOL OBLIGATIONS The goal of the project is to enable the Arab Republic of Syria to comply with its international commitments under the Montreal Protocol. Within the framework of this project, Syria will be assisted to adopt alternative fumigation procedures to such an extent that the country will be able to phaseout the use of methyl bromide (MB) in this sector in a sustainable way. POLICY ISSUES Strategic proposals for policy, legislative and regulatory action concerning the import and use of MB will be elaborated by the government of Syria and enforced. These policies are pre-requisites for the successful phase-out of MB and have to be in place to ensure no return to the use of MB once alternative measures have been successfully introduced.
